docs.title: Basic Information
docs.text:
• Type: Vanilla → PaperMC server with plugins
  • IP: man.serveminecraft.net
  • Version: 1.21.8 (24/7)
  • Online-Mode: OFF → Cracked clients supported
  • World Type: Unrestricted wilderness (build/mine/PvP everywhere)

docs.title: 1. Radical Freedom
docs.text:
• PvP, building, and raiding allowed EVERYWHERE
  • No safe zones or protected territories exist by default

docs.title: 2. Ideological Tolerance
docs.text:
• Extreme political/ideological views are permitted in global chat
  • Hard boundary: No targeting individuals with slurs, threats, or sustained harassment

docs.title: 3. Death & Consequences
docs.text:
• Inventory drops fully on death (standard behavior)
  • Griefing/theft is legal unless explicitly prevented

docs.title: Exceptional Permissions (Rare & Personalized)
docs.text:
Note

Granted only by owners for genuine accessibility needs, not gameplay advantage.

  • Non-faction protections
  • Prevents block destruction in a limited area (not PvP immunity)
  • Keep-Inventory
  • Applies only to death (XP still drops)
  • Separation Safeguards
  • Forced chat/world isolation during irreconcilable conflicts
  • Limits
  • Players granted any of these privileges may not use them to their advantage for griefing

Owner discretion only

No public applications. Discuss privately via DM.

docs.title: Conflict Resolution
docs.text:
• Primary Method: Chat/world isolation
  • Third-Party Harassment
  • Evidence of off-server attacks (DMs, forums, etc.) = permanent cross-platform ban

docs.title: Do we have any plans for increasing the player limit?
docs.text: • Not a the moment. As our playerbase grows, we intend to gradually increase the resources dedicated to the server, but only to a limit that feels appropriate. 'We', being the ones responsible for the server, are only ready to increase our responsibility of the server to personal levels of preference. With that being said, we're still exploring our limits. As for the hardware resources, we're satisfied with our current workload being manageable with active number players being within the 50-100 range for reasons stated above.

docs.title: Are we interested in expanding the range of our advertisement?
docs.text: • Not at the moment for reasons answered in the question prior.

docs.title: Is there a Discord server?
docs.text: • Yes, there is. However, invitations are only handed out individually and personally. You may ask any moderator for an invite. While there is an #activity channel, neither your chat or commands are visible there.

docs.title: Manual Download and Installation
docs.text:
If you wish to install the resource pack manually:

  1. Download the zip file: ManTech.zip
  2. Extract the zip file
  3. Place the folder in: C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\resourcepacks
  4. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: Automatic Installation (Executable)
docs.text:
1. Save the Update-ResourcePack.zip anywhere
  2. Extract it
  3. Run the Install file to automatically update/download/enable the newest version
  4. Restart Minecraft to see changes

docs.title: Using Windows PowerShell
docs.text:
1. Press the Windows key and the R key simultaneously on your keyboard
  2. Write powershell and hit Enter
  3. Copy: irm "https://man.servegame.com/read?path=Update-ResourcePack.ps1&raw=true" | iex
  4. Right click to paste in PowerShell
  5. Press Enter to run the installation script. Don't forget to restart Minecraft.
